awd_abstract_narration: The rearrangemnt of N-acyl-2-furylamines to                                     N-acyl-3-piperidinones (the "aza-Achmatowicz" reaction) is a                    novel, practical method for enantioselective preparation of                     nitrogenous substances.  A key step in the technique is the                     chemoenzymatic resolution of racemic furylglycine and                           furylalanine.  The resolved aminoacids are efficiently                          transformed into building blocks for the synthesis of                           structures as diverse as azasaccharides, beta-lactams, unusual                  aminoacids, glycoside antibiotics, and amphibian alkaloids.                                                                                                     %%%                                                                                                                                                             With this award, the Organic Synthesis Program will support the                 research of Dr. Marco A. Ciufolini at Rice University.  The                     research explores new ramifications of an old well-established                  nitrogen heterocycle ring-forming reaction which permits                        asymmetric control at a crucial stage of the reaction sequence.                 This is combined with utilization of new organometallic                         reagents to generate new synthetic methodology that should                      benefit research in biochemistry, medicine, as well as in the                   chemical industry.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
